definition: Long March (retreat of the Red Army 1934-1935)
expedition/long journey
length/long/forever/always/constantly
chief/head/elder/to grow/to develop/to increase/to enhance
to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
journey/trip/expedition/to go on long campaign/to attack

sentences.english: Reducing the number of HTTP requests in your page is the place to start.
sentences.chinese: 减少页面的HTTP请求数量只是万里长征第一步。

sentences.english: It is one of the key technologies in the development of LM-3A launch vehicle.
sentences.chinese: 冷氦增压是长征三号甲研制中的关键技术之一。

sentences.english: It just starts and there is still a long way to go.
sentences.chinese: 万里长征刚刚开始，以后还有很长的路要走。

sentences.english: The basic spirit of revering the nature had formed.
sentences.chinese: 在庞大族群的长征中，形成了敬畏自然的基本精神。

sentences.english: It is indeed the first step toward marching to a1,000-miledestination.
sentences.chinese: 这无疑是万里长征的第一步。

sentences.english: This road is like a long ribbon reddened by the blood of numerous martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 长征这条红飘带，是无数红军的鲜血染成的。

sentences.english: This year is the 70th anniversary of the Red Army.
sentences.chinese: 今年是红军长征胜利70周年。

sentences.english: There was no more time left. He must quit.
sentences.chinese: 没有更多的时间来考虑了，他必须退出长征。

sentences.english: This is a first step in a very long journey.
sentences.chinese: BP只是迈出了万里长征的第一步。

sentences.english: I chatted with him enthusiastically march their future path.
sentences.chinese: 我与他兴致勃勃地聊着他们未来的长征之路。

definition: communist attack against the Guomindang's encircle and annihilate campaign
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
Zunyi conference of January 1935 before the Long March
Nanchang Uprising, 1st August 1927, the beginning of military revolt by the Communists in the Chinese Civil War
Jinggangshan county level city in Ji'an 吉安, Jiangxi
Jinggang Mountains, in the Jiangxi-Hunan border region
Red Army (1928-1937), predecessor of the PLA/(Soviet) Red Army (1917-1946)
Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army
Resist US, help North Korea (1950s slogan)
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution

Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Song Renqiong (1909-2005), general of the People's Liberation Army
Huaihai Campaign (Nov 1948-Jan 1949), one of the three major campaigns by the People's Liberation Army near the end of the Chinese Civil War, considered the determining battle of the war
war of resistance, especially the war against Japan (1937-1945)
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
